publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2986# Alex Neil: STUC Emergency Motion on Prison Privatisation-That the Parliament supports the Scottish Trade Union Congress's emergency motion on prison privatisation which backs the findings contained in Privatised Prisons and Detention Centres in Scotland: An Independent Report by Phil Taylor and Christine Cooper; believes that the Scottish Executive should consider seriously how this report impacts on the Scottish Prison Service estates review; agrees that it is hard to believe that three new public prisons would cost £700 million more to build and run than three new private prisons, and calls for a full public debate on the philosophy and financial implications of prison privatisation. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2986# STUC Emergency Motion on Prison Privatisation (lodged on 16 April 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Michael Matheson*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2986# STUC Emergency Motion on Prison Privatisation (lodged on 16 April 2002) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Christine Grahame*
